Description: Hematite cylinder-seal; a kilted figure raises one hand and faces the ascending sun god who rests his foot on a rectangular mountain beneath a star-disc and a separate crescent while before him is a monkey; double lion-headed mace. Line border round the bottom of the seal. Crude execution; chipped.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (327)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
